intro: Aneilema gillettii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Aneilema gillettii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
